intro: Hemimeris unilabiata, commonly known as the one-lipped hemimeris, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that have a single lip-like petal, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. Hemimeris unilabiata is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its striking floral display.
